intro: Houlletia landsbergii, commonly known as the Landsberg houlletia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
